isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Air Compressor and Power Steering Pump

svcsection.title: Air Compressor and Power Steering Pump

geninfo.para: The air compressor and power steering pump assemblies are optional components on International® engines. They can be configured individually or together depending on vehicle application requirements.
Air for braking is supplied by an air compressor mounted on the lower left side of the engine. It is gear driven from the lower idler gear located within the front engine cover.

item.para: Lubrication of the compressor is provided by a hose connected at the engine oil pressure sensor port with oil draining back to the crankcase through an elbow at the bottom of the compressor.

Filtered air is furnished through an air hose connected to the air cleaner assembly, and compressed into a supply tank. When the air supply tank is full, compressed air is simply vented to the atmosphere.
Coolant to the compressor is supplied and returned through two hoses to ports located on the left side of the engine crankcase.

geninfo.para: The power steering pump assembly is mounted in one of two following configurations:

item.para: Without an air compressor, the power steering pump is mounted onto the front cover and is driven by the lower idler gear that would normally drive the air compressor.

With an air compressor, the power steering pump is mounted to the air compressor. The compressor is driven by the lower idler gear and power is transferred through the compressor crankshaft to drive the power steering pump.

note.para: For component service procedures other than removal and installation refer to the International Service Information Solutions - ISIS® and then select manufacturer from suppliers tab.
